0P000070KP.TO.summary: The Fund's investment objective is to provide strong capital growth over the long term. The Fund invests primarily in equities of American companies.
0P000070KP.TO.manager_bio:
Rob is Head of Small-Cap Equities for Trimark Investments, based in Toronto.

Rob hails from London, Ontario. He began his career as an analyst at The Loyalty Group. He then worked as a senior associate in the investment banking division of PricewaterhouseCoopers before joining the company in 1999 as a small-caps investment analyst. Rob became a portfolio manager in 2000. He earned a BBA from Wilfrid Laurier University, and he holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation.

0P00007146.TO.summary: To provide long-term growth through capital appreciation by investing primarily in smaller US companies that are identified to have above-average growth potential or to be undervalued.
0P00007146.TO.manager_bio: Mr. Aitken is currently the Managing Partner with Pembroke Management Ltd, overseeing all aspects of the firm's operations, including portfolio management, client services, business development, regulatory compliance, personnel and planning. He is also involved in a number of other not-for-profit organizations including The John Dobson Foundation, Martlet Research Trust and the St. Andrew's Society of Montreal.

0P000071YS.TO.long_name: IG Aristotle U.S. Small Cap Class A
0P000071YS.TO.summary: The Class aims to provide long-term capital growth by investing primarily in the common shares of small capitalization U.S. corporations or small cap corporations that conduct the majority of their business in the U.S.
0P000071YS.TO.manager_bio: In the nearly six years Richard has been with Investors Group, he has been a key member of the North American equities team. Recently, Richard has broadened his responsibilities regarding North American Health Care related investments into providing investment research inputs to a number of our global investment mandates.

0P0000729R.TO.long_name: Quadrus Mackenzie US Mid Cap Growth Cl Q
0P0000729R.TO.summary: The Fund seeks income and long-term capital growth by investing primarily in fixed income securities and income-oriented equities anywhere in the world, either directly or through other funds. It will generally invest 30% to 60% of its assets in equities.
0P0000729R.TO.manager_bio: Phil Taller, Vice President, Investment Management, is a Portfolio Manager on the Mackenzie Growth Team. His area of expertise is US mid-cap stocks. Phil has investment experience since 1991; Mackenzie Investments experience since July 2011. Phil has a Bachelorâs degree in Mathematics and Computer Science from the University of Waterloo and an MBA from the Schulich School of Business at York University. He is also a CFA charterholder.

Steve MacMillan is a portfolio manager for Pyramis Global Advisors, a Fidelity Investments company. He manages Fidelity Small Cap America Fund and is a member of Team Canada, the Canadian equity research team for investment products sold through Fidelity Investments Canada ULC. 

Steve earned a BBA from Wilfred Laurier University and is a Chartered Financial Analyst charterholder.

0P0001HG8J.TO.short_name: Hillsdale US Small Cap Equity F
0P0001HG8J.TO.long_name: Hillsdale US Small Cap Equity Fund Series A CA$ (U$Hedged)
0P0001HG8J.TO.summary: To provide Unitholders with a rate of return on capital in excess of the Russell 2000 Total Return Index, with volatility generally similar to the Index.
0P0001HG8J.TO.manager_bio: Mr. Guthrie is responsible for establishing corporate strategy and leading its implementation and execution. As Chief Investment Officer, he also has ultimate responsibility for all portfolio management decisions made by the firm. Prior to founding Hillsdale in January 1996, Mr. Guthrie was one of the original employees of a Toronto-based investment counsel firm responsible for the design and sale of software and models used in the management of quantitative equity portfolios.
